Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
I believe safety is left up adults to present themselves as adults. However, when such situations occur, authorities are there to resolve issues in a respectable manner.
Students can get involved in just about any club or activity they are interested in.

This university is great for people who nature. Also, for those who like great social environments, this is the place to be. Most importantly, anyone who wants to be successful and pursue a career, come to Alcorn.
We have a lot of historical sites and buildings near and on the campus. We have chicken Wednesdays and Fish Friday's, were the mentioned entrees are served.

We have programs that significantly prepare students for which ever field they choose to go into. We have people from various careers who come and give us insight on what it take to be in their profession.
I like play volleyball, read,go bowling, walk the campus, and enjoy the beautiful trees.
The food in the cafe is good. Based on what type of meal plan you choose, you will have other options. There is a Sub-Connection,Starbucks and a Pizza Hut.

I live in the newer dorms and the experience has been great. You share a room with three other people. It has a full bath area, a fridge, sink, and TV in the living area. You also have your personal closet and desk area.
Come with the intentions to learn.
Students should make sure they are ready for this type of environment. We are in the country and it brings about a different experience.
Alcorn has a great mentors. The campus is a safe environment. The professors here make sure that you learn the material.

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot Especially if one is pursuing a career in any science program. Login to rate or flag the reviews Tracy from Pinola, MS 02/21/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 out of 4 people found this review useful. 3 of 38 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Alcorn is a great school for students who love the country. Tips for prospective students If you expect to go to a school in the city and party all the time do not come to Alcorn. If you expect to just party do not come to Alcorn because education comes first and the administrators will not mind sending you home because you flunked out. Bang for the buck Alcorn does not have the best dorms, buildings, etc., but it is a great school. Am enjoying being here
